pages.text:
We support grassroots aviation by having an active flight school and an outstanding maintenance shop. Integrity and ethics are part of every decision we make in our business. We’re proud that one third of our staff are veterans, and we thank ALL veterans for their service.
We are lucky to call the beautiful Emerald Coast our home and hope you will consider our business to serve your aviation needs when you visit our area.
Bruce Bowman
Executive Vice President and General Counsel
Bruce Bowman serves as the Executive Vice President and General Counsel for Emerald Coast Aviation.  He has practiced law for over 35 years and has been board-certified in civil trial law since 2000.  Bruce has extensive experience in business law and corporate management and is always available to satisfy the needs of our customers
Beau Watts
Operations Manager
Beau brings over 30 years of aviation experience, and is responsible for all our flight operations including fueling, fuel quality assurance, aircraft servicing and hangar inquiries. Beau values every customer relationship and treats all customers like family.
Karen Hardell
Chief Financial Officer
Karen L. Hardell, CPA, has served as our Chief Financial Officer since 2018. Karen brings decades of financial leadership experience, plus a keen entrepreneurial insight to the executive team at Emerald Coast Aviation.
Randy Ells
Director of Maintenance
Randy’s passion for aviation started when he was a young child growing up in the Indianapolis area attending air shows. Randy went to Vincennes University where he received his associate degree in aviation maintenance technology. Randy is a licensed A&P mechanic with inspection authorization and has over 15 years of aviation experience, mostly in general aviation. Randy has his private pilot’s license where he enjoys flying leisurely when he is able. He has factory maintenance training in Cirrus aircraft along with many other airframes. He enjoys spending his weekends with family and friends, the beaches on the Emerald Coast, and the golf course.
Travis Hill
Chief Pilot
Travis serves Emerald Coast Aviation as Chief Instructor and Chief Pilot for Emerald Coast Air Charters. He brings 34 years of aviation experience to include over 6,000 flight hours and 28 years of military service with 8 years of command at multiple levels. His strengths in leadership development and risk management allow for an increase in performance and give way to a positive culture within his aviation team. His qualifications include Class II, active CFI/CFII/MEI and TS/SCI.
Jennifer Blackwood
Comptroller
I started working for Emerald Coast Aviation in November, 2011, as the Customer Service Rep, and after a short move to Minnesota to be closer to family, I came back to work as the Comptroller. My love and passion for our amazing workplace is unlike any I have ever experienced. I can’t imagine working anywhere else.

Bob Sikes Airport (KCEW) is named after US Congressman Bob Sikes and first opened to the public in 1963. KCEW is a
self-sufficient public use general aviation airport
located in Crestview, Florida.
At more than 8,000 feet long and 150 feet wide, the airport boasts the longest general aviation runway in the Florida Panhandle. The airport is home to many industries and some of the largest employers in Okaloosa County, and there is room to grow. There are 170 acres that can be developed on the airport and an additional 110 acres in the adjacent airpark. The County has already put in place stormwater and other requirements, has provided for sound mitigation and put in place a fast permitting process for future growth.
Emerald Coast Aviation (ECA)
has been the Fixed Base Operator for KCEW since winning the contract and taking over in January 2009. Since that time, ECA has invested more than two million dollars in improvements and equipment at Bob Sikes.
These improvements are evident on visiting the airport
:
5,000 square foot terminal building fully equipped with a pilot’s lounge, kitchen and comfortable lobby and meeting areas
On-site modernly equipped 145 repair station with highly qualified maintenance staff
New above-ground fuel farm and well maintained fueling equipment; two brand new fuel trucks
Enhanced and expanded parking and ramp areas
Emerald Coast Aviation is a locally-owned family business. We love the General Aviation community and we take pride in our first-class facilities and our friendly, professional service.
Proudly Supporting Our Community

Emerald Coast Aviation
